intro: Chaenopleura stenobotrys, commonly known as the narrow-leafed chaenopleura, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a climbing or trailing plant characterized by its simple, opposite, and often lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on the stems. Its botanical features include a woody stem with adventitious roots and a preference for moist, shaded environments. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in humid, lowland forests.
